description: UMD 2.5.0 is the 7th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><div><b>EMI Technology Provider:</b><br></div><div>Job Execution services:<br></div><div>CREAM Torque 2.0.1 </div><div><ul><li>Released in SL5 and SL6:<br></li><li>This is an update of the CREAM TORQUE module providing several bug fixes.<br></li><li>No new functionalities<br></li></ul></div><div>WMS 3.4.1 </div><div><ul><li>Released in SL5 and SL6:<br></li><li>This relase solves the bug about the WMS UI could not handle jobids starting with a -;</li></ul></div><div>Blah 1.18.3</div><div><ul><li> Released in both Sl5 and Sl6<br></li><li>This release solves a vulnerability bug</li></ul></div><div>Job Scheduling services:</div><div>TORQUE server config v. 1.0.1-1:</div><div><ul><li>Released in  both Sl5 and Sl6<br></li><li>This release solves the following bug: CREAM CE/YAIM: add knob to disable SSH key scanning<br></li></ul></div><div>Monitoring services:<br></div><div>L&B version 3.2.10 released in both SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This bugfix release of L&B addresses several distinct issues relating to nagios probe customization, proper handling of rarely used authorization roles, and purging of jobs from the L&B Proxy. <br></li></ul></div><div><b>IGE Technology Provider:<br></b></div><div>File Access, File Transfer:<br></div><div>GridFTP 5.2.3</div><div><ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<br></li><li>This release now provides for default disk and network stacks: globus-gridftp-server options -dc-default and -fs-default. It also provides server support for setting file modification tim and the ability (MLSC) to stream directory listings over the control channel.<br></li></ul></div><div>Interactive Job management<br></div><div>Gsisshterm 1.3.4 </div><div><ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<br></li><li>This release allow to turn on VOMS support and also add VOMS support when using MyProxy Tool.<br></li></ul></div><div>Job Execution<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre; ">	</span><br></div><div>Gram5</div><div><ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<br></li><li>This release only provides bug Fix.<br></li></ul></div>
installationNotes: All products in the UMD 2.5.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd-2/">EGI repository</a>.
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="http://ggus.eu">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: <div>Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in:&nbsp;<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.5.0">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.5.0</a></div>
changeLog: <div>This releases includes updates for the following products:</div><div><ul><li>Cream-torque<br></li><li>Wms<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: emi.blah
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.



CREAM exposes a web service interface.
products.releaseNotes: This release solves a vulnerability bug
products.changeLog: This release solves a vulnerability bug

products.name: emi.cream-torque
products.releaseNotes:
This is an update of the CREAM TORQUE module providing the fix for the following bugs:



lcg-info-dynamic-scheduler-pbs cannot parse qstat output with spurious lines

Missing real value for GlueCEPolicyMaxSlotsPerJob

Time limits for GLUE 2 are different to GLUE 1
products.changeLog:
This is an update of the CREAM TORQUE module providing the fix for the following bugs:



lcg-info-dynamic-scheduler-pbs cannot parse qstat output with spurious lines

Missing real value for GlueCEPolicyMaxSlotsPerJob

Time limits for GLUE 2 are different to GLUE 1

products.name: emi.lb
products.releaseNotes: This bugfix release of L&B addresses several distinct issues relating to nagios probe customization, proper handling of rarely used authorization roles, and purging of jobs from the L&B Proxy. Minor documentation updates were done to address the fixed issues.

products.name: emi.torque-server
products.releaseNotes: This is an update of the TORQUE server providing the fix for the following bug: CREAM CE/YAIM: add knob to disable SSH key scanning
products.changeLog: This is an update of the TORQUE server providing the fix for the following bug: CREAM CE/YAIM: add knob to disable SSH key scanning

products.changeLog: Bug fixed : EMI-2 WMS UI cannot handle jobids starting with a -
